ResearchProjectDef.label: Clockwork Principle
ResearchProjectDef.description: Early industrialisation, this teaches you how to setup more advanced way of gathering resources and process them into more useful things. Trash, raw materials, or scrap metal goes in one side and useful products come out the other.\nThese very early devices are made with cogs and chutes and are powered by wood and coal.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
Welcome to Project RimFactory Beta!

We invite you on a trip through automation, starting with wood and coal fueled smelters and advancing through AI-controlled self-improving assemblers.

General Usage: Store materials in the white designation Input area for the machine to consume. After a bit of work, the machine will place the finished product on it's yellow Output tile.

The oldest known clockwork machine is the Antikythera mechanism, found in 1901 in a shipwreck dated at 50BC and Greek in origin. A series of 30 gears was used to predict eclipses and other astronomical phenomenon as well as the passage of years. Advanced clockwork mechanisms reached new heights in Europe during the 1800s, and even today automation without computers is used in industry.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Euler's identity
ResearchProjectDef.description: "π is pi, the ratio of the circumference of a circle to its diameter." Learn the basics of automation and mechanisms, the gateway to an industrialized colony.\nDevelop the mathematical models necessary to further automate simple processes with electricity such as stonecutting and cooking.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Leonard Euler developed mathematical systems for intemacractions between physics, geometry and algebra.\nWith these formulas, automated production of basic materials such as stone bricks and simple art is possible.\nPlace items within the white designation for the bills to consume, they will be output to the adjustable green tile.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Moritz Machinery
ResearchProjectDef.description: A machine that can predict outcomes will solve many of the design flaws we have been facing. Imagine a machine that could improve itself...\nWe will need an factory research terminal linked to our hi-tech research bench to go further.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText:
The mathematical models developed in the 1700s began an industrial revolution all of the world, series of gears and pressurization allowed the mass processing of basic materials with coal and electricity.
Moritz von Jacobi managed to propel a boat with an electric motor in 1845, but it wasn't until 1837 when Thomas and Emily Dacenport patented the first motor in the US that the promise of electro-mechanical machinery was seen as the next big leap forward.
Rudimentary programming allows storing a bill on a Recipe Database and importing it into an assembler.
-The blue region around assemblers and recipe databases indicate the data transfer area.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Turing implementation
ResearchProjectDef.description: Anything can be described as a series of 1s and 0s as long as there enough 1s and 0s.
ResearchProjectDef.discoveredLetterText: Refinements to machinery allow sophisticated machines, such as those that self-correct (get faster the more times they complete a job), drills with object recognition to only mine what you want and the first mechanite swarm technologies.\n-mechanite machines interact with a couple random tiles in the area every second.
